Name: Stela of Ankhnesneferebre
Description: The stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, of the Lady Ankhnesneferebre is an ordinary stela with a semicircular top decorated with stars and the winged sun disk, which dominates the upper part of the stela. The stela is divided into two scenes. On the left, an offering scene depicts the king, whose name is written in a cartouche over his head, in front of the god Amun and his wife Mut. On the right, another offering scene shows Ankhnesneferebre in front of Amun and his son Khonsu. Below these two scenes, there is a hieroglyphic text, containing a prayer to the god and the name and epithet of Ankhnesneferebre.
